fields.name: Initial Setup
fields.value:
1. [Invite the bot](https://modmail.xyz/invite).
2. Run `=setup` in your server.
3. Done! :tada:

[You can use `=help` for a list of commands.](https://modmail.xyz/commands)

fields.name: Premium
fields.value:
Please consider purchasing premium for more features!
This includes full conversation logging, custom greeting and closing messages, as well as snippets.

[Learn more about ModMail Premium](https://modmail.xyz/premium).

fields.name: Advanced Setup
fields.value:
Some additional commands you could use are:
- `=pingrole <roles>`: For the bot to ping certain roles when tickets are created.
- `=accessrole <roles>`: For configuring which roles can reply to ModMail tickets.
- `=anonymous`: For toggling anonymous staff replies to hide the responder's name.
 - This does not work for making your end-user anonymous.
- `=logging`: For toggling log messages of tickets being opened or closed.
 - This does not log a transcript of the messages.
- `=commandonly`: For toggling if commands are required to reply to tickets.
 - If **disabled** staff have only to type in the channel for their message to be sent.
 - If **enabled** staff have to reply with `=reply` or `=areply`.

You can mention the roles, use role IDs or role names.
For role names with a space, it needs to be in quotes (e.g. \"Head Admin\")
